document_data.caption: A map showing the Tannath Gap along the River Umber.
document_data.name: Tannath Gap
document_data.mainbody: The '''Tannath Gap''', often called just '''The Gap''', was a forested highland between the [[Tannath Mountains]] and the rest of the [[Dragonjaw Mountains]], around the [[River Umber]], opposite [[Singing Sands]].

Geography.Flora & Fauna:
The area was covered with [[blue-needle pine]] and [[fir]]. The largest mammal seemed to be [[deer]]: there were [[raccoon]]s, [[fox]]es, [[opposum]]s, [[badger]]s and [[squirrel]]s. [[Otter]]s and [[beaver]]s lived in the bodies of water, and birds such as [[hawk]]s, [[heron]]s and [[crow]]s were present as well. The predators included [[cougar]]s.

There were few enchanted creatures in the Gap; [[griffon]]s from the [[Tannath Mountains]] flew over at some times. [[Cath shee]], believed to be descended from the original [[elven]] inhabitants, were also known to exist there as of {{yearlink|1368}}. It was believed monsters had been hunted to extinction in the region.

document_data.Trade: As of {{yearlink|1372}}, the River Umber had become a major trade road in the region. People downstream on Aglarond preferred not to fish there, distrusting the [[Thay]]ans upstream.
document_data.Defenses: The [[Aglarondan]]s rarely patrolled the Gap, believing the terrain to be sufficiently disuassive to most invaders.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: A small clan of [[werefox]]es was believed to be hunting in the woods as of {{yearlink|1368}}.
document_data.Inhabitants: Woodcutters and hunters lived along the piedmont, making their homes in small cottages.
